verses.verse: And it came <S%G1096><s%> about when <S%G1722><s%> He went <S%G2064><s%> into the house <S%G3624><s%> of one <S%G5100><s%> of the leaders <S%G758><s%> of the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> on [the] Sabbath <S%G4521><s%> to eat <S%G2068><s%> bread, <S%G740><s%> that they were watching <S%G3906><s%> Him closely. <S%G3906><s%>
And there, <S%G2400><s%> in front <S%G1715><s%> of Him was a certain <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G444><s%> suffering <S%G5203><s%> from dropsy. <S%G5203><s%>

And Jesus <S%G2424><s%> answered <S%G611><s%> and spoke <S%G3004><s%> to the lawyers <S%G3544><s%> and Pharisees, <S%G5330><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Is it lawful <S%G1832><s%> to heal <S%G2323><s%> on the Sabbath, <S%G4521><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> not?"
But they kept <S%G2270><s%> silent. <S%G2270><s%> And He took <S%G1949><s%> hold <S%G1949><s%> of him, and healed <S%G2390><s%> him, and sent <S%G630><s%> him away. <S%G630><s%>

And He said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "Which <S%G5101><s%> one of you shall have a son <S%G5207><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> an ox <S%G1016><s%> fall <S%G4098><s%> into a well, <S%G5421><s%> and will not immediately <S%G2112><s%> pull <S%G385><s%> him out on a Sabbath <S%G4521><s%> day <S%G2250><s%>?"
And they could <S%G2480><s%> make <S%G470><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> reply <S%G470><s%> to this. <S%G3778><s%>

And He [began] speaking <S%G3004><s%> a parable <S%G3850><s%> to the invited <S%G2564><s%> guests <S%G2564><s%> when He noticed <S%G1907><s%> how <S%G4459><s%> they had been picking <S%G1586><s%> out the places <S%G4411><s%> of honor <S%G4411><s%> [at the table;] saying <S%G3004><s%> to them,

"When <S%G3752><s%> you are invited <S%G2564><s%> by someone <S%G5100><s%> to a wedding <S%G1062><s%> feast, <S%G1062><s%> do not take <S%G2625><s%> the place <S%G4411><s%> of honor, <S%G4411><s%> lest <S%G3379><s%> someone more <S%G1784><s%> distinguished <S%G1784><s%> than you may have been <S%G1510><s%> invited <S%G2564><s%> by him,

and he who invited <S%G2564><s%> you both <S%G2532><s%> <S%G846><s%> shall come <S%G2064><s%> and say <S%G3004><s%> to you, 'Give <S%G1325><s%> place <S%G5117><s%> to this <S%G3778><s%> man, <S%G3778><s%>' and then <S%G5119><s%> in disgrace <S%G152><s%> you proceed <S%G757><s%> to occupy <S%G2722><s%> the last <S%G2078><s%> place. <S%G5117><s%>

"But when <S%G3752><s%> you are invited, <S%G2564><s%> go <S%G4198><s%> and recline <S%G377><s%> at the last <S%G2078><s%> place, <S%G5117><s%> so <S%G2443><s%> that when <S%G3752><s%> the one who has invited <S%G2564><s%> you comes, <S%G2064><s%> he may say <S%G3004><s%> to you, 'Friend, <S%G5384><s%> move <S%G4320><s%> up higher <S%G511><s%>'; then <S%G5119><s%> you will have honor <S%G1391><s%> in the sight <S%G1799><s%> of all <S%G3956><s%> who are at the table <S%G4873><s%> with you.
"For everyone <S%G3956><s%> who exalts <S%G5312><s%> himself <S%G1438><s%> shall be humbled, <S%G5013><s%> and he who humbles <S%G5013><s%> himself <S%G1438><s%> shall be exalted. <S%G5312><s%>"

And He also <S%G2532><s%> went on to say <S%G3004><s%> to the one who had invited <S%G2564><s%> Him, "When <S%G3752><s%> you give <S%G4160><s%> a luncheon <S%G712><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> a dinner, <S%G1173><s%> do not invite <S%G5455><s%> your friends <S%G5384><s%> or <S%G3366><s%> your brothers <S%G80><s%> or <S%G3366><s%> your relatives <S%G4773><s%> or <S%G3366><s%> rich <S%G4145><s%> neighbors, <S%G1069><s%> lest <S%G3379><s%> they also <S%G2532><s%> invite <S%G479><s%> you in return, <S%G479><s%> and repayment <S%G468><s%> come <S%G1096><s%> to you.

"But when <S%G3752><s%> you give <S%G4160><s%> a reception, <S%G1403><s%> invite <S%G2564><s%> [the] poor, <S%G4434><s%> [the] crippled, <S%G376><s%> [the] lame, <S%G5560><s%> [the] blind, <S%G5185><s%>

and you will be blessed, <S%G3107><s%> since <S%G3754><s%> they do not have <S%G2192><s%> [the means] to repay <S%G467><s%> you; for you will be repaid <S%G467><s%> at the resurrection <S%G386><s%> of the righteous. <S%G1342><s%> "

And when one <S%G5100><s%> of those <S%G3588><s%> who were reclining <S%G4873><s%> [at the table] with Him heard <S%G191><s%> this, <S%G3778><s%> he said <S%G3004><s%> to Him, "Blessed <S%G3107><s%> is everyone <S%G3748><s%> who <S%G3748><s%> shall eat <S%G2068><s%> bread <S%G740><s%> in the kingdom <S%G932><s%> of God! <S%G2316><s%>"
But He said <S%G3004><s%> to him, "A certain <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G444><s%> was giving <S%G4160><s%> a big <S%G3173><s%> dinner, <S%G1173><s%> and he invited <S%G2564><s%> many; <S%G4183><s%>

and at the dinner <S%G1173><s%> hour <S%G5610><s%> he sent <S%G649><s%> his slave <S%G1401><s%> to say <S%G3004><s%> to those <S%G3588><s%> who had been invited, <S%G2564><s%> 'Come; <S%G2064><s%> for everything is ready <S%G2092><s%> now. <S%G2235><s%>'

"But they all <S%G3956><s%> alike <S%G575><s%> <S%G1520><s%> began <S%G757><s%> to make <S%G3868><s%> excuses. <S%G3868><s%> The first <S%G4413><s%> one <S%G4413><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to him, 'I have bought <S%G59><s%> a piece <S%G68><s%> of land <S%G68><s%> and I need <S%G318><s%> to go <S%G1831><s%> out and look <S%G3708><s%> at it; please <S%G2065><s%> consider <S%G2192><s%> me excused. <S%G3868><s%>'

"And another <S%G2087><s%> one <S%G2087><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> 'I have bought <S%G59><s%> five <S%G4002><s%> yoke <S%G2201><s%> of oxen, <S%G1016><s%> and I am going <S%G4198><s%> to try <S%G1381><s%> them out; please <S%G2065><s%> consider <S%G2192><s%> me excused. <S%G3868><s%>'

"And another <S%G2087><s%> one <S%G2087><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> 'I have married <S%G1060><s%> a wife, <S%G1135><s%> and for that reason <S%G1223><s%> I cannot <S%G1410><s%> <S%G3756><s%> come. <S%G2064><s%>'

"And the slave <S%G1401><s%> came <S%G3854><s%> [back] and reported <S%G518><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> to his master. <S%G2962><s%> Then <S%G5119><s%> the head <S%G3617><s%> of the household <S%G3617><s%> became angry <S%G3710><s%> and said <S%G3004><s%> to his slave, <S%G1401><s%> 'Go <S%G1831><s%> out at once <S%G5030><s%> into the streets <S%G4116><s%> and lanes <S%G4505><s%> of the city <S%G4172><s%> and bring <S%G1521><s%> in here <S%G5602><s%> the poor <S%G4434><s%> and crippled <S%G376><s%> and blind <S%G5185><s%> and lame. <S%G5560><s%>'

"And the slave <S%G1401><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> 'Master, <S%G2962><s%> what <S%G3739><s%> you commanded <S%G2004><s%> has been <S%G1096><s%> done, <S%G1096><s%> and still <S%G2089><s%> there is room. <S%G5117><s%>'

"And the master <S%G2962><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to the slave, <S%G1401><s%> 'Go <S%G1831><s%> out into the highways <S%G3598><s%> and along the hedges, <S%G5418><s%> and compel <S%G315><s%> [them] to come <S%G1525><s%> in, that my house <S%G3624><s%> may be filled. <S%G1072><s%>
'For I tell <S%G3004><s%> you, none <S%G3762><s%> of those <S%G1565><s%> men <S%G435><s%> who were invited <S%G2564><s%> shall taste <S%G1089><s%> of my dinner. <S%G1173><s%>' "
Now <S%G1161><s%> great <S%G4183><s%> multitudes <S%G3793><s%> were going <S%G4848><s%> along <S%G4848><s%> with Him; and He turned <S%G4762><s%> and said <S%G3004><s%> to them,

"If <S%G1487><s%> anyone <S%G5100><s%> comes <S%G2064><s%> to Me, and does not hate <S%G3404><s%> his own father <S%G3962><s%> and mother <S%G3384><s%> and wife <S%G1135><s%> and children <S%G5043><s%> and brothers <S%G80><s%> and sisters, <S%G79><s%> yes, <S%G2089><s%> and even <S%G2532><s%> his own <S%G1438><s%> life, <S%G5590><s%> he cannot <S%G1410><s%> <S%G3756><s%> be My disciple. <S%G3101><s%>

"Whoever <S%G3748><s%> does not carry <S%G941><s%> his own <S%G1438><s%> cross <S%G4716><s%> and come <S%G2064><s%> after <S%G3694><s%> Me cannot <S%G1410><s%> <S%G3756><s%> be My disciple. <S%G3101><s%>

"For which <S%G5101><s%> one of you, when he wants <S%G2309><s%> to build <S%G3618><s%> a tower, <S%G4444><s%> does not first <S%G4413><s%> sit <S%G2523><s%> down <S%G2523><s%> and calculate <S%G5585><s%> the cost, <S%G1160><s%> to see if <S%G1487><s%> he has <S%G2192><s%> enough to complete <S%G535><s%> it?

"Otherwise, <S%G2443><s%> <S%G3361><s%> when <S%G4218><s%> he has laid <S%G5087><s%> a foundation, <S%G2310><s%> and is not able <S%G2480><s%> to finish, <S%G1615><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> who observe <S%G2334><s%> it begin <S%G757><s%> to ridicule <S%G1702><s%> him,
saying, <S%G3004><s%> 'This <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G444><s%> began <S%G757><s%> to build <S%G3618><s%> and was not able <S%G2480><s%> to finish. <S%G1615><s%>'

"Or <S%G2228><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> king, <S%G935><s%> when he sets <S%G4198><s%> out to meet <S%G4820><s%> another <S%G2087><s%> king <S%G935><s%> in battle, <S%G4171><s%> will not first <S%G4413><s%> sit <S%G2523><s%> down <S%G2523><s%> and take <S%G1011><s%> counsel <S%G1011><s%> whether <S%G1487><s%> he is strong <S%G1415><s%> enough <S%G1415><s%> with ten <S%G1176><s%> thousand <S%G5505><s%> [men] to encounter <S%G5221><s%> the one coming <S%G2064><s%> against <S%G1909><s%> him with twenty <S%G1501><s%> thousand <S%G5505><s%>?

"Or <S%G1161><s%> else, <S%G7507><s%> while the other <S%G846><s%> is still <S%G2089><s%> far <S%G4206><s%> away, <S%G4206><s%> he sends <S%G649><s%> a delegation <S%G4242><s%> and asks <S%G2065><s%> terms <S%G4314><s%> of peace. <S%G1515><s%>

"So <S%G3779><s%> therefore, <S%G3767><s%> no <S%G3956><s%> <S%G3756><s%> one <S%G3956><s%> of you can <S%G1410><s%> be My disciple <S%G3101><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> does not give <S%G657><s%> up all <S%G3956><s%> his own <S%G1438><s%> possessions. <S%G5225><s%>

"Therefore, <S%G3767><s%> salt <S%G217><s%> is good; <S%G2570><s%> but if <S%G1437><s%> even <S%G2532><s%> salt <S%G217><s%> has become <S%G3471><s%> tasteless, <S%G3471><s%> with what <S%G5101><s%> will it be seasoned <S%G741><s%>?

"It is useless <S%G3777><s%> <S%G2111><s%> either <S%G3777><s%> for the soil <S%G1093><s%> or <S%G3777><s%> for the manure <S%G2874><s%> pile; <S%G2874><s%> it is thrown <S%G906><s%> out. He who has <S%G2192><s%> ears <S%G3775><s%> to hear, <S%G191><s%> let him hear. <S%G191><s%>"
